content: 88 yards note gauge is more important than needle size please swatch and block to determine the correct size needles to give you gauge about our raglan increases needles 4 5mm us7 32 or 40 circular needles and 4 5mm us7 dpn s or magic loop for ribbing the main increase used in this sweater is a kfb 5mm us8 32 or 40 circular needles and 5mm knit front & back to work this stitch you knit us8 dpn s or magic loop for main into the front of the stitch and then without passing the stitch off the needles you then knit yarn requirements one strand dk weight yarn into the back of the stitch to increase by one this can be substituted for two strands of stitch here is a link to a video showing this fingering weight yarn if you want to fade or marl technique your colours whatever you choose to use please ensure you swatch to ensure the correct we also use the backwards loop increase for gauge can be achieved increasing the neckline and for creating armpit stitches here is a link to a video showing this yarn used as shown in main picture tiny teal technique handcrafted 100% merino dk 225m per 100g in urban graffiti and coal colourways abbreviations the estimated meterage is calculated as the k knit pattern is written you can easily change the p purl length of the body or sleeves to suit your mc main colour personal style however please be aware that cc contrast colour this may increase the amount of yarn needed kfb a neutral increase which leaves a purl bump to the left of the increase stitch total meterage / yardage required backwards loop a neutral increase mds make double stitch during short row 600 625 650 720 790 870 950 1050 1150 pm place marker meters sm slip marker rm remove marker 656 683 711 787 863 951 1039 1149 1258 bor beginning of round yards wr wrong side rs right side please note if using fingering weight held together with alpaca or mohair or held double the required meterage is per strand the colour block boxy tee -
